III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & COF Rule 400.10177 Resident Restraint
Section (1) The facility shall establish and follow written policy and
Description procedures specifying the use of resident restraint.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/11/24, youth covered a camera in their room and was being
non-compliant when asked to remove it. A staff attempted to
uncover the camera and youth grabbed the staff's arm. Staff
executed a physical restraint which took youth down to the
mattress they were both standing on. Youth reported staff used
excessive force and assaulted him by putting their arm on his
throat. The camera did not capture any of the incident due to it
being covered.
Investigation INTERVIEWS:
Complainant/Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed face
to face at the facility on 3/14/24 in conjunction with MDHHS
Worker. CA reported Youth A told her he was going to get the
facility shut down and was going to sue them before this incident
occurred. CA reported Staff 1 said Youth A grabbed him, so Staff
1 completed a physical restraint on Youth A. CA reported Youth A
covered the camera in his room prior to the incident, so nothing
can be seen on the video. CA reported she asked why Staff 1
didn’t yell louder for help and CA told her he wasn’t yelling
anymore due to the last investigation he was in during September
2023 (SIR2023C0000744). CA reported whether Youth A grabbed
Staff 1 or grabbed the broom Staff 1 was holding, they cannot
allow youth to have a weapon, and the broom would have been
considered one. CA reported after the incident, Staff 1 went to the
doctor because his back was hurt. CA noted Youth A always
complies with Staff 1, so this interaction was completely abnormal.
CA reported based on this situation the facility implemented a new
policy regarding cameras being covered in youth bedrooms, which
states staff should not go into a youth’s bedroom alone.
Administrator was interviewed face to face at the facility on
3/14/24 in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Administrator
stated Staff 1 was a floater on 3/11/24 and responded to a call
asking for him to help with Youth A’s behavior. Administrator
spoke with Youth A after the incident and wrote his statement of
what happened. Administrator reported Youth A repeated “Your
staff assaulted me. Get a hold of my attorney. I’m going to sue.”
multiple times. Administrator reported Youth A has a history of
using wet toilet paper or tissue to cover the camera and
barricading the door, so he can assault staff when they enter the
2

room. Administrator noted this behavior has happened at previous
placements as well.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/14/24
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he was
called by Supervisor 2 to assist with Youth A because Youth A
was banging the security flap on his door, which came loose, and
Youth A covered the camera in his bedroom. Staff 1 reported
when he went to Youth A’s bedroom, he closed the security flap
and locked it. Then he asked Youth A to remove the tissue from
the camera in his room. Youth A replied he wasn’t going to
uncover it until he could speak with his worker from Health West.
Staff 1 reported he left the pod and came back with a broom to
uncover the camera, since Youth A refused. Youth A stood on top
of the bed to block the camera so Staff 1 couldn’t uncover it. Staff
1 reported he asked Youth A to get down two times, but Youth A
refused. Staff 1 reported he stood on the bed and tried to go
around Youth A to uncover the camera with the broom handle.
Staff 1 reported Youth A grabbed Staff 1’s wrist with one hand and
the broom handle with the other. Staff 1 reported he had to let go
of the broom so he could get out of the way because he was
concerned Youth A was going to assault him. Staff 1 reported he
physically restrained Youth A and demonstrated a Primary
Restraint Technique (PRT) hold during the interview (Youth A’s
arms behind his back with Staff’s arms around Youth A’s arms,
and Staff’s hands on Youth’s back). Staff 1 noted performing the
restraint was a struggle because they were standing on top of the
bed, so it was unsteady. Staff 1 reported they fell onto the bed and
Youth A was moving around and fighting. Staff 1 reported he
called out for help and Supervisor 1 entered the room within a
couple seconds. Staff 1 reported he was still on the bed with
Youth A and Supervisor 1 called a code 1 for assistance. Staff 1
reported he released Youth A from the restraint once Youth A
calmed down and stopped struggling. Staff 1 reported he asked
Youth A to calm down multiple times during the incident. Staff 1
reported after he released Youth A and got up, Youth A alleged
Staff 1 assaulted him. Staff 1 reported he and CA left the room
and went to see if there was any video footage, but there wasn’t
because the camera was covered. Staff 1 reported he went to the
doctor after the incident and was diagnosed with a strained back.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/8/24. Staff 2 reported
she was on another pod with other youth when she heard Staff 1’s
voice on Youth A’s pod. Staff 2 reported she opened the door to
Youth A’s pod and saw Staff 1 had a broom in his hand. Staff 1
told Staff 2 he was going to uncover Youth A’s camera. About 5-6
3

minutes later, Staff 2 reported she heard commotion and heard
Staff 1 yelling “move back”. Staff 2 reported she opened the door
to Youth A’s pod again and saw Staff 1 and Youth A on the bed
scuffling. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 was on top of the bed and Youth
A was lying face up on the bed with his head towards the end of
the bed. Staff 2 reported Youth A’s head was not hanging off the
bed. Staff 2 reported she wasn’t sure if they fell, if Staff 1 was
trying to do a restraint or something else was happening because
she didn’t see how it started. Staff 2 reported she secured the
youth in her pod and came back onto Youth A’s pod to help. When
she arrived in Youth A’s room, Youth A was standing up, yelling,
and saying Staff 1 assaulted him. Youth A reported Staff 1 told
him to move back so he could remove the paper from the camera.
Youth A stated when Staff 1 leaned forward to try and get the
paper off, Youth A grabbed the broom. Youth A stated he was
going to sue the facility because Staff 1 assaulted him.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed via phone on 4/2/24. Supervisor
1 reported he did not see the entire incident. Supervisor 1
reported he exited another youth’s room and heard a commotion,
so he went to Youth A’s room. When he entered the room, Staff 1
and Youth A were already on the bed with Youth A laying down
and Staff 1 sort of laying at a 45-degree angle on the bed next to
him. Supervisor 1 reported they were centered on the bed, but
Youth A kept fighting and moving all over the bed. Supervisor 1
reported it looked like Staff 1 was trying to get Youth A in the right
position to restrain him, and Youth A was trying to roll his body
over and around to avoid getting restrained. Supervisor 1 told
Youth A to calm down and called a code 1 for assistance.
Supervisor 1 could not remember if Staff 1 was successful in
getting Youth A in a restraint on the bed. Supervisor 1 reported he
didn’t see Staff 1 do anything concerning, didn’t see Staff 1
assault Youth A, and didn’t see Staff 1 use any excessive force.
Supervisor 1 reported he never saw Youth A’s head hanging off
the bed and never saw Staff 1’s forearm on Youth A’s neck.
Supervisor 1 reported the only thing he was concerned about was
Staff 1 didn’t yell louder for help. Supervisor 1 reported he talked
to Staff 1 about it, and Staff 1 reported he doesn’t yell anymore.
Supervisor 1 reported he informed Staff 1 there are times like this
situation where yelling is necessary.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed via phone on 4/17/24. Supervisor
2 reported when she responded to the code 1 and arrived at
Youth A’s room, Youth A was laying on the bed on his back with
his head towards the end of the bed. Supervisor 2 reported Youth
A’s head was on top of the mattress on the bed and was not
4

hanging off the bed. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1 was on the bed
but was not on top of Youth A. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1 was
holding Youth A’s arms, and it looked like he was trying to get
Youth A back into position to do a PRT hold since they fell onto
the bed. Supervisor 2 reported it appeared there was no way for
Staff 1 to flip Youth A over to get into the PRT hold, so she told
Staff 1 to let Youth A go. Supervisor 2 reported Staff 1 got off the
bed and left the room.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on 3/14/24
in conjunction with MDHHS Worker. Youth A initially reported
he did not want to be interviewed because the situation “wasn’t a
big deal”. However, Youth A reluctantly agreed to be interviewed.
Youth A reported he covered his camera because he wanted to
speak with his worker and thought it would force staff to allow him
to talk to her. Youth A reported Staff 1 came into his room with a
broom, so Youth A stood on his bed. Youth A reported Staff 1
stood on the bed as well. Youth A reported he moved out of Staff
1’s way, but then reached up and grabbed the top of the broom.
Youth A reported Staff 1 grabbed him by his shoulders while they
were facing each other, then turned him around, and held his
arms behind his back. When Youth A demonstrated the
positioning, it looked like the physical restraint hold Staff 1
demonstrated during his interview. Youth A then changed his story
and stated his arms were never behind him, and Staff 1 held his
arms crossed in front of him. When Youth A was asked how they
ended up on the bed, Youth A stated Staff 1 tripped him to get him
down on the bed. However, then Youth A stated they were both
standing on the bed and were moving around so much, it caused
them to fall. Youth A reported after they fell onto the bed, Staff 1’s
forearm was on Youth A’s head with Youth A’s head hanging off
the bed and his face to the side.
VIDEO REVIEWED:
Video footage from 3/11/24 in Youth A’s room as well as the
milieu area outside of Youth A’s room was reviewed. Note:
nothing in the bedroom can be seen until after the incident occurs
since Youth A covered the camera, but there is audio.
Staff 1 is seen entering Youth A’s room with broom at 1:41pm.
Staff 1 and Youth A’s interaction can be heard, but not seen
because Youth A’s bedroom camera was covered. Youth A says
“No, get out of my room bro”. A broom handle can be seen going
toward the camera. Staff 1 says “watch out man”. On the pod
camera, Supervisor 1 is seen leaving a youth’s room next to Youth
A’s room and Staff 1 yells “Hey! Hey [Supervisor 1]”. Supervisor 1
5

enters Youth A’s room at 1:42pm and says “Woah! Woah! Stop.”
Supervisor 1 calls a code 1 and asks Youth A to calm down.
Youth A repeatedly tells Staff 2, Supervisor 1, Supervisor 2,
Administrator and CA that Staff 1 grabbed him and assaulted him.
Youth A also states a couple times he wants to call his lawyer
because he is “going to sue the shit out of this place”.
DOCUMENTS REVIEWED:
• Policy for fights, disturbances, and use of force and/or
restraints (dated 2/22/23) states only the minimal amount of
force necessary shall be used to control a youth or situation
in the facility. Restraints are never applied as punishment
and may only be used as long as necessary to prevent
youth from injuring self or from damaging property. Youth
are prohibited from the use of physical force in any
situation. Detention staff can use direct physical force to
prevent injury to others and property damage. Staff using
physical force or witnessing physical force being used shall
immediately call for assistance. Staff will follow Handle with
Care protocol, using verbal and physical techniques, to de-
escalate the situation.
• Reviewed Handle with Care Behavior Management System
Handbook with pictures and description of PRT hold which
are consistent with the hold described by Staff 1.
• Email from MDHHS Worker dated 3/12/24. MDHHS Worker
stated Youth A’s Foster Care Worker (FCW) reported
[Youth A] has a history of assaulting staff in placement.
During one assault at another facility, [Youth A] had
another youth cover the camera before assaulting a staff.
• Youth A’s statement given to Administrator after incident on
3/11/24 occurred was not consistent with his interview.
Youth A’s statement says, “I grabbed the broom all the way
to the very top. [Staff 1] turned around and grabbed me
with two hands and tried to push me against the wall. [Staff
1] placed his hands on my shoulders. I grabbed his
shoulders. I turned my backside from the wall and his
backside went to the wall. Then [Staff 1] tripped me. I went
forward and my head went to the end of the bed. Then
[Staff 1] placed his forearm on my head. After my neck was
already hanging off the bed, [Staff 1] called for [Supervisor
1], and [Staff 1] was still on top of me. [Supervisor 1] called
code 1, and [Staff 1] got off of me.”
6

• Youth A’s medical assessment dated 3/11/24 notes [Youth
A] reported the left side of his neck was in pain. Nurse
noted there were no injuries or acute medical issues
identified at the time of assessment, so no further action
was necessary. Youth A told Nurse “I’m suing him. I’m hurt
on my neck. He can’t put his hands on me”.
• Incident report dated 3/11/24 authored by Staff 1 and
Supervisor 2.
o Staff 1 reported Supervisor 2 told him to go to the
pod and uncover [Youth A’s] camera. He asked
Youth A to uncover his camera and Youth A said “he
ain’t uncovering shit until we get his worker”. Staff 1
returned with a broom to uncover the camera and
[Youth A] stood on the bed blocking Staff 1 from the
camera. Staff 1 stood on the bed with the broom to
uncover the camera and [Youth A] grabbed Staff 1’s
hand, trying to take the broom from him. Staff 1
notes he felt assaulted, so he physically restrained
[Youth A] and asked Supervisor 1 to call a code 1.
o Supervisor 2 notes when she entered [Youth A’s]
room, she observed [Staff 1] in a physical restraint
on the bed. Supervisor 2 noted she asked Staff 1 to
tap out and leave the area so they can get the full
story of what happened since [Youth A’s] camera
was covered. Supervisor 2 assured [Youth A] [Staff
1] was trying to get the tissue off the camera and the
only way to do that was by using the broom handle.
[Youth A] admitted to standing on his bed and trying
to get the broom handle from [Staff 1]. Supervisor 2
told [Youth A] standing on the bed attempting to grab
anything from staff is unacceptable. [Youth A] began
to laugh as Supervisor 2 informed [Youth A] he didn’t
follow directives about personal boundaries. [Youth
A] was seen by medical and he was sore but didn’t
have injuries that would require further action.
• Incident report dated 3/11/24 authored by Staff 2 and
Supervisor 1.
o Staff 2 noted [Staff 1] opened the flex door to the
pod and [Staff 1] was telling [Youth A] to stop
kicking. [Youth A] demanded [Supervisor 2] or
somebody else come talk to him. Staff 2 noted she
closed the door because [Supervisor 1] entered the
pod. Staff 2 then heard yelling and opened the door
again. Staff 2 saw [Staff 1] and [Youth A] tussling at
7

the end of the bed. Staff 2 ran to secure her
residents, and then went to help on the other pod.
Staff 2 noted when she got to [Youth A’s] room,
[Youth A] was with [Supervisor 2] and [Staff 1] was
on the right side of the bed.
o Supervisor 1 noted he was checking on a youth in
the pod when he heard a commotion coming from
[Youth A’s] room. Supervisor 1 reported he observed
[Staff 1] and [Youth A] on the bed in what appeared
to be a struggle. Supervisor 1 entered the room and
gave verbal directives to [Youth A] to calm down,
and then called a code 1.
• Staff 1 completed Handle with Care training on 7/25/22,
7/20/23, and 11/21/23, which includes verbal de-escalation
training as well as verbal and physical interventions with
youth. Staff 1 has 3 disciplinary actions and 9 coaching
sessions in his employee file. One disciplinary action has to
do with inappropriate behavior (cursing, screaming, hostile
physical demeanor) towards a youth at the facility in
September 2023.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as based on interviews
conducted, video footage and documents reviewed, there isn’t
sufficient information to prove that Staff 1 assaulted Youth A or
used excessive force during the incident.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
